alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 3:23PM PST until December 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * CHANGES...Winter Weather Advisory timing changed to 7 pm. Winter Storm Watch Upgraded to a Winter Storm Warning. * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches with 5 to 12 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting to 35 mph, with ridge wind gusts exceeding 80 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet, except 4 to 8 feet above 7000 feet. Wind gusts to 40 mph, with ridge wind gusts exceeding 100 mph, are likely. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially by Wednesday night and Thursday. Strong winds could cause areas of tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may mix with rain at times below 6500 feet Wednesday and Wednesday night. There may be a break in heavier snow late Thursday night and Friday.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the major storm arrives later Wednesday, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
